Package com.intellij.openapi.fileTypes

Class LanguageFileType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.fileTypes.LanguageFileType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileType, Scheme
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BuildoutCfgFileType, CommandLineFileType, DTDFileType, GroovyFileType, IgnoreFileType, JavaFileType, JqlFileType, JShellFileType, JsonFileType, JsonSchemaFileType, ManifestFileType, MarkdownFileType, MockLanguageFileType, PlainTextFileType, PropertiesFileType, PythonFileType, QtFileType, RegExpFileType, RestFileType, RncFileType, ScratchFileType, ShFileType, SPIFileType, SubstitutedFileType, TemplateDataElementType.TemplateFileType, TextMateFileType, XmlLikeFileType, XPathFileType, YAMLFileType, YouTrackFileType

    public abstract class LanguageFileType
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileType
    Kind of file types capable to provide Language. Note that the associated language can still be overridden by a LanguageSubstitutor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LanguageFileType

        protected LanguageFileType(Language language)
        Creates a language file type for the specified language.
        Parameters:
        language - The language used in the files of the type.

      • LanguageFileType

        protected LanguageFileType(Language language,
                           boolean secondary)
        Creates a language file type for the specified language.
        Parameters:
        language - The language used in the files of the type.
        secondary - If true, this language file type will never be returned as the associated file type for the language. (Used when a file type is reusing the language of another file type, e.g. XML).

    • Method Detail

      • getLanguage

        public final Language getLanguage()
        Returns the language used in the files of the type.
        Returns:
        The language instance.

      • isBinary

        public final boolean isBinary()
        Description copied from interface: FileType
        Returns true if files of the specified type contain binary data. Used for source control, to-do items scanning and other purposes.
        Specified by:
        isBinary in interface FileType
        Returns:
        true if the file is binary, false if the file is plain text.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Description copied from interface: FileType
        Returns true if the specified file type is read-only. Read-only file types are not shown in the "File Types" settings dialog, and users cannot change the extensions associated with the file type.
        Specified by:
        isReadOnly in interface FileType
        Returns:
        true if the file type is read-only, false otherwise.

      • isSecondary

        public boolean isSecondary()
        If true, this language file type will never be returned as the associated file type for the language. (Used when a file type is reusing the language of another file type, e.g. XML).

      • getCharset

        public java.lang.String getCharset(VirtualFile file,
                                   byte [] content)
        Description copied from interface: FileType
        Returns the character set for the specified file.
        Specified by:
        getCharset in interface FileType
        Parameters:
        file - The file for which the character set is requested.
        content - File content.
        Returns:
        The character set name, in the format supported by Charset class.
